title: Sensex Slips 800 Points A Day After Record Rally, Nifty Down 200 Points
content: Indian equities opened in the red this morning, a day after the markets saw a record rally due to major geopolitical developments, including India and Pakistan agreeing to a ceasefire and the US and China striking a trade deal.

title: India Pakistan Ceasefire Live Updates: Pakistan Went Around Seeking Global Help After India's Attacks, Says PM Modi
content: India Pakistan Ceasefire LIVE Updates: Operations against Pakistan have only been kept in abeyance and the future will depend on their behaviour, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said.

title: 14 Die After Allegedly Consuming Toxic Liquor In Amritsar
content: At least 14 people have died in five villages in Punjab's Amritsar after allegedly consuming spurious liquor, leading to the arrest of five accused, officials said on Tuesday.

title: BJP's Nationwide 'Tiranga Yatra' Today To Honour Armed Forces
content: In a significant nationwide outreach effort, the BJP will begin its 11-day-long Tiranga Yatra' on Tuesday to honour the courage and sacrifice of India's armed forces, particularly in light of the recently concluded and successful 'Operation Sindoor'

title: Shashi Tharoor's Note For "Immortal" Virat Kohli As He Retires From Tests
content: Virat Kohli, the former captain of Team India, announced on Monday that he was ending his 14-year-long Test journey.

title: "Everybody Should Pay Same": Inside Trump's Order To Slash Drug Prices In US
content: US President Donald Trump has signed an executive order directing pharmaceutical companies to slash drug prices so they match those abroad.

title: What Sources Said On Trump's Trade Claim Over India-Pakistan Ceasefire
content: US President Donald Trump's claim that ceasefire between India and Pakistan was achieved with the promise of trade, has been denied by government sources.

title: 2 Indian Students Killed In US Car Crash, Consulate In Touch With Families
content: Two Indian students have died in a road accident in Lancaster County, United States, last week. The victims, identified as 23-year-old Saurav Prabhakar and 20-year-old Manav Patel, were students at Cleveland State University in Ohio.

title: "Safety In Mind": Air India, IndiGo Cancel Flights To 7 Cities Today
content: These airports are among those that were reopened for civilian flights on Monday after being temporarily shut amid rising tensions between India and Pakistan.

title: Massive Rally In Wall Street After US, China De-Escalate Trade War
content: Wall Street stocks finished solidly higher Monday, cheering an announcement that the United States and China sharply de-escalated a trade war that has rattled global markets.

title: "Bhay Binu Hoi Na Preeti": Air Marshal Quotes Ramcharitmanas On Op Sindoor
content: At a serious military briefing, one doesn't expect high literature and text from epics to be quoted by a battle-hardened air warrior to drive home a point.

title: US Announces New Sanctions Against Iran As Talks Proceed
content: The United States announced new sanctions Monday against Iran over its nuclear program, despite ongoing negotiations between the two countries over the sensitive issue.

title: Air India Announces Flight Cancellations For Today Amid India-Pak Tensions
content: Air India on Tuesday announced the cancellation of two-way flight operations to and from Jammu, Leh, Jodhpur, Amritsar, Bhuj, Jamnagar, Chandigarh and Rajkot for Tuesday.

title: "Waha Se Goli, Yaha Se Gola": PM's Strong Message To Army On Pak Escalation
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi told the armed forces that the country's response to every action by Pakistan should be more forceful.

title: Hollywood Stars Condemn Gaza "Genocide" On Eve Of Cannes Festival
content: More than 350 figures from the cinema world including Hollywood stars Richard Gere and Susan Sarandon condemned "genocide" in Gaza in an open letter published Monday on the eve of the Cannes Festival.

title: In PM Modi's Takedown Of Pakistan, A Mention Of Bahawalpur, Muridke "Terror Universities"
content: Pakistan's terror universities, located at the very heart of the nation, have been destroyed beyond recognition, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Monday, as he address the nation for the first time since Operation Sindoor.

title: Relationship With China Is Now "Very Good": Trump After Geneva Trade Talks
content: Following trade talks in Geneva, in which the United States and China agreed to withdraw reciprocal tariffs for an initial 90-day period, US President Donald Trump described the outcome as a "total reset" in relations with China.

title: "Could've Been A Bad Nuke War," Claims Trump. What PM Modi Said Shortly After
content: Donald Trump has taken credit for having "stopped a nuclear conflict - a bad one" in the brink of time. Both India and Pakistan have "lots of nuclear weapons", said the US President, adding that the two nations were going at it "hot and heavy".

title: IndiGo Cancels Flights To Amritsar, 5 Other Cities For Today
content: IndiGo has cancelled its flights to and from Jammu, Amritsar, Chandigarh, Leh, Srinagar and Rajkot for May 13.

title: Crushed Homes, Empty Streets: West Bank No Different From Gaza After Israeli Offensive
content: The West Bank has remained under Israeli military occupation after it was seized during the 1967 Six-Day War.

title: Tatum carried off in Celtics' Game 4 loss; MRI next
content: Celtics star Jayson Tatum will have an MRI on Tuesday after suffering an apparent noncontact lower leg injury late in the fourth quarter of Boston's Game 4 loss to the Knicks on Monday night.

title: Mavericks win NBA draft lottery with 1.8% odds
content: The Dallas Mavericks won this year's NBA draft lottery, earning the right to land projected No. 1 pick Cooper Flagg.

title: Yanks' Cabrera taken off in ambulance after slide
content: Yankees third baseman Oswaldo Cabrera appeared to injure his left leg when he reached back for the plate on an awkward slide Monday night in Seattle.

title: Brunson reminds Knicks 3-1 'nothing to celebrate'
content: As the Knicks took a commanding 3-1 series lead on the Celtics and moved within a win of their first Eastern Conference finals appearance in 25 years, captain Jalen Brunson was quick to remind his teammates, "It's nothing to celebrate."

title: Sources: Kings expected to name Holland next GM
content: Ken Holland, who won four Stanley Cups as an executive with the Detroit Red Wings and helped lead the Edmonton Oilers to a runner-up finish last season, is expected to become general manager of the Los Angeles Kings, sources confirmed to ESPN on Monday.

title: Cristobal: QB Beck cleared for summer workouts
content: Miami coach Mario Cristobal said Monday that quarterback Carson Beck has been cleared to participate in all team summer activities following elbow surgery last year.

title: NCAA prez is open to Trump's idea of commission
content: NCAA president Charlie Baker said Monday he was "up for anything" when asked about the idea of a commission on collegiate athletics, an idea proposed by President Donald Trump.

title: Chiefs superfan gets 32 years for Okla. robbery
content: Chiefs superfan Xaviar Babudar was sentenced in an Oklahoma courtroom Monday to 32 years in prison, two and a half years after authorities caught him in the state as he fled from a local bank robbery.

title: ðŸ“ˆ Tiering who can swing a Giannis blockbuster
content: For the first time in his career, the two-time MVP is reportedly open to a trade. How ready is every team to swing a deal?

title: Two-round NBA mock draft: Predicting all 59 picks post-lottery, with risers and fallers
content: With the Mavericks winning the lottery and the right to draft Cooper Flagg, here's ESPN's updated two-round mock.

title: 10 moves that shaped the WNBA offseason -- and what they mean for 2025
content: Seven head coaching changes. Veterans on the move. Teams rebuilding. Here's a rundown of the key developments.

title: Ranking the top 25 WNBA players
content: How do A'ja Wilson, Napheesa Collier, Breanna Stewart and Caitlin Clark stack up in our preseason rankings?

title: PGA Championship tier rankings: From Scottie and Rory to just happy to make the cut
content: Can Rory McIlroy win his second major of the year? Which LIV golfers can contend? We break down the PGA Championship at Quail Hollow (Starts Thursday on ESPN/ESPN+).

title: Ranking non-Round 1 rookies who could star this NFL season: 10 on offense, 10 on defense
content: We picked out players chosen on Days 2-3 of the 2025 draft who could contribute right away, including Saints QB Tyler Shough.

title: If anyone can bring the World Cup back to Brazil in 2026, it's Ancelotti
content: The worst-kept secret is out: Carlo Ancelotti is going to be the new Brazil manager. His task -- winning a first World Cup for the Selecao since 2002 -- isn't an easy one, but if anyone can do it, Ancelotti can.

title: Barcelona win fourth ClÃ¡sico and close on LaLiga, Chelsea lose top-four clash, more
content: Barcelona made it four wins in four games against rivals Real Madrid this season, taking a big step toward winning LaLiga in the process. Also, Chelsea's top-four hopes took a self-inflicted hit vs. Newcastle.

title: The VAR Review: Why Jackson was sent off for an elbow but Mings escaped
content: How did Aston Villa's Tyrone Mings escape a red card yet Chelsea striker Nicolas Jackson was sent off?

title: Brazil announce Ancelotti as new head coach
content: Carlo Ancelotti will be the first foreign coach of Brazil, the CBF announced on Monday. However, Real Madrid are yet to confirm his exit from the club.

title: Mascherano: Everything not 'fine' at Inter Miami
content: Inter Miami CF coach Javier Mascherano has stated that "there are things that need to be corrected" following a poor run of form and 4-1 defeat to Minnesota United on Saturday.

title: Sources: Alonso close to being named Madrid boss
content: Real Madrid are finalising a deal for Xabi Alonso to become their new coach as soon as possible, multiple sources have told ESPN, with the club keen to have him in place for this summer's Club World Cup.

title: Bundesliga champ Kane: What will they say now?
content: Harry Kane has brushed off the criticism he has received during his wait for his first career trophy, saying "we'll see what people talk about now."

title: Wrexham to play July friendlies in Australia, NZ
content: Wrexham AFC will play three A-League clubs as part of a preseason friendly tour across Australia and New Zealand in July.

title: 15,000 'violent' Argentine fans banned from CWC
content: Argentine Security Minister Patricia Bullrich handed the United States Embassy in Buenos Aires on Monday a list of 15,000 violent soccer fans who will be banned from stadiums during the upcoming Club World Cup.

title: France aims to copy Premier League finance model
content: French football intends to have its own version of the Premier League, with a club-owned entity replacing the Ligue de Football Professionnel (LFP) as part of plans announced by French Football Federation president Philippe Diallo on Monday.

title: Fight grades: Could Montreal end up as one of the top PPVs of 2025?
content: UFC 315 wasn't the biggest card of the year on paper, but the fights were entertaining minus one blemish.

title: Olney: The X factors defining this year's trade deadline
content: Breaking down the the themes that will shape the 2025 deadline and the teams that could be a part of it.

title: Impact freshmen and talented transfers: These teams have the best groups of newcomers for 2025
content: Building a roster isn't just about recruiting. Combining prep talent with great transfers is key in college football and these teams did it best.

title: The biggest questions after a wild first week of the second-round series
content: The biggest questions and what to watch for after an exciting start to the second round of the 2025 NBA playoffs.

title: MLS Power Rankings: Minnesota routs Miami to climb the order
content: After rocking Miami 4-1, Minnesota is closing in on the Herons in the top 10 of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern eyeing moves for Wirtz, Tah
content: Will Bayern Munich sign either one of Bayer Leverkusen's Florian Wirtz or Jonathan Tah? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Betting the Eurovision Song Contest: How European sportsbooks navigate Europe's most popular betting niche
content: The annual Eurovision Song Contest is this week. Doug Greenberg takes a look at some of the most popular bets.

title: Operation Sindoor: Turkish drones to Chinese missiles, India beat them all
content: India's integrated air defense network successfully thwarted Pakistani aerial attacks, including Turkish drones and Chinese missiles, during recent hostilities. Military officials showcased evidence of Pakistan's use of advanced weaponry, most of which were intercepted. The robust AD system, incorporating indigenous weapons like Akash, ensured the safety of Indian airspace and military installations.

title: Meet the IAF personnel who played a key role in Operation Sindoor
content: India's robust air defence system successfully thwarted numerous missile and drone attacks launched by Pakistan, ensuring the nation's security. Operation Sindoor highlighted the crucial role of the Integrated Air Command and Control System. PM Modi acknowledged the air defence system's effectiveness in intercepting and destroying Pakistani threats aimed at civilian targets, exposing Pakistan's actions to the world.

title: 'Dance of the Hillary': Guard your data, cops warn of Pak virus onslaught
content: Indian intelligence agencies have discovered a Pakistan-linked cyber-attack campaign, distributing malware named 'Dance of the Hillary' through social media platforms like WhatsApp and Facebook. This malware, spread via video or document files, steals sensitive user data and enables remote device control. Punjab Police issued a cyber alert, urging vigilance against suspicious links to protect personal and national security.

title: US-China trade: Trump says he called Apple CEO after China tariff rollback and ...
content: Following a US-China trade agreement where tariffs are suspended for 90 days, President Trump claimed Apple CEO Tim Cook plans to increase US investments, potentially building more plants. This news follows reports of Apple considering iPhone price hikes, possibly linked to tariffs.

title: At least 14 dead after consuming spurious liquor in Amritsar
content: Tragedy struck Amritsar as at least 14 people died and several others were hospitalized after consuming spurious liquor in villages under the Majitha block. Authorities have launched a probe, detaining five individuals and registering two FIRs. Raids are underway to apprehend more manufacturers, with officials providing assistance to affected families and working to prevent further casualties.

title: Exclusive: 'There's only one Tendulkar and there's only one Kohli'
content: In an exclusive interview with Timesofindia.com, former South Africa cricketer Mark Boucher goes down memory lane and recollects the time he shared the dressing room with a young Virat Kohli during his three-year stint with the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) from 2008-10. The former gloveman revealed how he helped Kohli hone his technique against short-pitched bowling and explained why his eagerness to learn and aggressive mindset laid the foundation for his stellar career.

title: Microsoft is getting tougher on employees, and this 'ban' is proof
content: Microsoft is implementing a two-year rehire ban for employees ousted due to performance issues, categorizing these departures as 'good attrition.' This shift signals a stricter approach to workforce management, preventing the return of underperformers. The company terminated 2,000 employees without severance and introduced a globally consistent performance improvement plan.

title: Barca push the knife further into Madrid, inch closer to 28th La Liga title
content: Barcelona beat Real Madrid 4-3 on Sunday and went seven points clear at the top of La Liga and within touching distance of a 28th league title. They're now on the verge of doing a domestic double. Or treble if you also include the Spanish Super Cup.

title: Nifty50 tanks below 24,700; BSE Sensex dips over 700 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in early trade on Tuesday a day after an over 3.5% rally. While Nifty50 went below 24,750, BSE Sensex was below 81,700.

title: Bill Gates' ex-wife opens up on his plan to give away wealth: 'Think it's...'
content: Melinda French Gates supports the Gates Foundation's plan to spend its $200 billion endowment by 2045 on global health, emphasizing the original intent to give back to society. The foundation will double its spending to combat diseases and poverty. French Gates believes billionaires have a moral obligation to contribute, hoping for lasting positive impact even after the foundation closes.

title: â€˜Influenced by tantrikâ€™, woman throws 2-year-old â€˜possessedâ€™ son into canal
content: In a incident, a 35-year-old woman, allegedly under the influence of an occult practitioner, has been arrested for throwing her two-year-old son into a canal in Faridabad. Authorities are currently searching for the child's body. The woman's husband revealed she believed their son was possessed, influenced by the occultist's claims, leading to this tragic event.

title: Air India cancels flight operations at 8 locations; issues advisory
content: Air India and Indigo have announced the cancellation of flight operations to and from several locations, including Jammu, Leh, Jodhpur, Amritsar, and Chandigarh, for today, May 13th. This decision was made in light of recent developments and with passenger safety as the top priority. Air India is closely monitoring the situation and will provide updates as they become available.

title: 'Virat ko chhod do, dusre bhai ko padha likha lo': The making of Kohli
content: Atul Wassan recalls a young Virat Kohli's early days, recognizing his special talent at age 12. Wassan nurtured Kohli, selecting him for Ranji Trophy. Kohli's impact on cricket is undeniable, similar to legends like Hayden and Gilchrist. After retiring from Test cricket, Kohli aims to enjoy life, focusing on IPL and potentially the Olympics, prioritizing family and personal fulfillment.

title: Operation Sindoor: Armed forces used wide range of space assets, both Indian and foreign
content: During Operation Sindoor, Indian armed forces utilized a range of domestic and international space assets, including Cartosat and Risat satellites, alongside commercial data from Maxar. ISRO facilitated repeatable data and plans to launch EOS-09 or Risat-1B on May 18, enhancing surveillance with all-weather, high-resolution imagery.

title: CA gives major update on players unwilling to return to India for IPL
content: The Indian Premier League is set to resume on May 17. Cricket Australia is backing players who opt out due to safety concerns. The World Test Championship final is approaching soon. Several key Australian players are involved. Coaches and commentators are also considering their return. The IPL's resumption will be closely monitored for both cricket and player safety.

title: Kohli's Ranji coach drops bombshell: 'He was preparing for England Tests'
content: Virat Kohli's recent Test retirement shocked the cricketing world, including his former coach Sarandeep Singh, who revealed Kohli was actively preparing for the upcoming England series and showed no prior indications of stepping down. Singh mentioned Kohli's eagerness to replicate his 2018 success in England, making his sudden exit unexpected, especially with the crucial Test series against England approaching.

title: Virat Kohli memes break internet as fans speculate on his ODI retirement
content: Virat Kohli's sudden Test retirement has sparked a frenzy of reactions online, with fans sharing tributes and speculations about his ODI future. Having already retired from T20s, it's widely assumed the 2027 Cricket World Cup could be his last appearance. His coach, Rajkumar Sharma, lauded Kohli's Test career and hopes for ODI success.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock market recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's Somil Mehta recommends buying CDSL and Indian Bank. CDSL, with a buy range of Rs 1290-1270, targets Rs 1378, having broken a downward trend. Indian Bank, buy range Rs 570-580, aims for Rs 615, supported by its 40-day moving average.

title: 'He'll be there to ... ': Kohli's childhood coach's 2027 ODI WC prediction
content: Rajkumar Sharma, Virat Kohli's childhood coach, lauded Kohli's remarkable Test career following his unexpected retirement. Sharma expressed pride in Kohli's contributions and voiced optimism for his continued commitment to ODI cricket. He hopes Kohli will lead India to victory in the 2027 ICC ODI World Cup, anticipating another glorious chapter in his career.

title: Trump cites 'racial discrimination' as first batch of white SA refugees land in US
content: In a controversial move, the Trump administration granted refugee status to 49 white South Africans, mostly Afrikaners, citing racial persecution. Welcomed by US officials, President Trump defended the decision, alleging a "genocide" against white farmers, a claim South Africa vehemently denies. Critics highlight the contradiction with Trump's restrictive immigration policies, while allies like Elon Musk support his concerns.

title: Two Indian students killed in fatal road accident in Pennsylvania
content: Two Indian students from Cleveland State University tragically died in a car crash on the Pennsylvania Turnpike in Lancaster County. Saurav Prabhakar, 23, and Manav Patel, 20, were pronounced dead at the scene due to multiple traumatic injuries after their vehicle left the roadway and struck a tree and bridge.

title: If hit by terror, reply wonâ€™t differentiate between govt sponsor & masterminds: PM
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi issued a stern warning to Pakistan, urging them to dismantle "terror universities" for their own survival, following India's successful Operation Sindoor. Modi emphasized India's military superiority and resolve against terrorism, asserting that any talks with Pakistan would only address terrorism and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: 'Lowest price in the worldâ€™: How Trump plans to cut drug costs by 80%
content: Donald Trump's executive order aims to drastically cut US prescription drug prices, aligning them with the lowest prices in developed nations. Pharmaceutical companies face a 30-day window to voluntarily comply or face potential regulatory actions. The order targets intermediaries and promotes drug importation from countries like Canada.

title: 'Eyes welled up when it worked', says man behind Akash defence system
content: The indigenous Akash missile defence system, developed over 15 years by Indian scientists, successfully countered Pakistani drone and missile attacks along the western border. Prahlada Ramarao, the project director, expressed immense pride in the system's performance, highlighting its cost-effectiveness. Inspired by Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam, the project overcame challenges in developing the Rajendra radar.

title: Raid 2 box office Day 12: Ajay Devgn starrer hits Rs 125 crore mark
content: Ajay Devgn's Raid 2 has achieved remarkable success at the Indian box office, accumulating over Rs 125 crore within 12 days. Despite a slight dip on its second Monday, the film benefited from the Buddha Purnima holiday and maintained a steady performance. The film's worldwide gross is approaching Rs 170 crore, with strong contributions from international markets.

title: Fear can be unlearnedâ€”and this hormone can be the key
content: A recent MIT study in mice reveals dopamine's crucial role in fear extinction. Researchers discovered that dopamine activates specific neurons in the amygdala, linked to reward, which drives the unlearning of fear. This suggests that overcoming fear isn't just suppression but a positive learning process, potentially opening new avenues for treating anxiety and PTSD.

title: Heads or tails? Fate of 2 candidates sealed by a flip
content: In Assam's panchayat elections, Purabi Rajkhowa and Nalin Lekhathopi emerged victorious in Nagaon and Golaghat districts after a coin toss decided their fate due to a tie in votes. Both candidates and election officials were surprised by the tie-breaking method, which is permissible under election regulations. Despite the unusual circumstances, both winners and their opponents accepted the results gracefully.

title: Who was Rakesh Poojary? Comedian who passed away at age of 34
content: Karnataka's beloved comedian, Rakesh Poojary, tragically passed away at 33 due to a heart attack on May 11. He collapsed at a friend's mehendi event and was immediately hospitalized. Known for his work on 'Comedy Khiladigalu,' where he was a runner-up in 2018 and winner in 2020, Rakesh also starred in films like 'Pailwaan' and several Tulu movies.

title: 'Our favourite you': Dwyane Wade pens heartfelt words for Gabrielle Union
content: Dwyane Wade celebrated Gabrielle Union on Mother's Day with heartfelt Instagram posts, showcasing their love and family bond. Union, deeply touched, reposted the messages with emotional emojis. Amidst Wade's health recovery and raising their daughter, Union also shared her experiences with racism in Hollywood, highlighting the challenges she faced regarding beauty standards and opportunities.

title: AIIMS Bhopal student in city for cultural fest found dead in AFMC hostelâ€™s washroom
content: An AIIMS Bhopal student was discovered dead in an AFMC hostel washroom in Pune, with a stab wound. He was attending a cultural festival and had missed his bus back home. Police are investigating the possibility of suicide, noting the student's history of depression and a message indicating he was 'fed up with life'. A knife was found near the body, and authorities are awaiting further investigation.

title: IPL 2025 new schedule: Check venues, timings, date & fixtures
content: The BCCI has officially announced the updated schedule for IPL 2025. The tournament is set to resume on May 17, with the final scheduled for June 3, as per the revised plan. Following extensive consultations with government authorities, security agencies, and key stakeholders, the Board has decided to move ahead with the remainder of the season.

title: College baseball Week 13: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: the LSU Tigers are back at No. 1 after the way they played on the road against the Arkansas Razorbacks . last week's top team the Texas Longhorns dropped a couple spots after losing its series to the Florida Gators . the Gators have managed to climb back in the top 25 at no. 23 .

content: Carlo Ancelotti will leave real madrid at the end of the season to take charge of the brazilian national team . ancelotti has been diagnosed with a sprain in his left ankle, the club said . he will take charge from may 26 when the laLiga season concludes .

title: Takeaways: Knicks take a commanding 3-1 lead
content: the second round of the 2025 playoffs is here . the no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers kicked off the East semis by taking a 2-0 lead over the No. 1 seed Cleveland Cavaliers . lopsided game 4 win gave the team a 3-1 series lead in the series .

title: US aims to slash drug prices, India shielded
content: a business journalist with around two decades of experience tracking key consumer-focussed sectors like consumer durables, retail, consumer goods, aviation, automobiles and advertising . now, writes primarily on pharmaceuticals and healthcare, and on issues of consumer interest .

title: At least 14 die after consuming spurious liquor in Punjab
content: Police said six people have been hospitalised with complications caused by hooch, five people have been arrested

title: Markets drop in early trade after sharp rally in previous session
content: The 30-share BSE benchmark gauge Sensex, declined by 497.5 points to 81,932.40 in early trade. The NSE Nifty dropped 117.2  points to 24,807.50

title: Former MP Kesineni Srinivas alleges death threat, lodges complaint with Vijayawada Police Commissioner
content: Nani accuses Chakravarthy Kadiyala of making a death threat on May 11 and being hand-in-glove with MP Kesineni Sivanath in liquor scam Â

title: Districts Collectors in A.P. told to ensure compliance with MLAsâ€™ protocol courtesiesÂ
content: Chief Secretary K. Vijayanand issues memo to District Collectors, after the issue was highlighted by Assembly Speaker Ch. Ayyanna Patrudu

title: Between Pahalgam attack and Operation Sindoor: Indiaâ€™s social media war
content: Platform X became the arena not just for India and Pakistanâ€™s social media war, but the digital harassment of civilians who dared to voice even a slightly contrary opinion

title: Foreign Secretary Misri to brief parliamentary panel on situation with Pakistan on May 19
content: The committee's chairman and Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said that Vikram Misri will brief the panel on Monday (May 19, 2025) on the developments, which were marked by India striking terror sites in Pakistan

title: A painterâ€™s plea for global unity through art and sport
